Six hundred miles off the coast of South America, there's a place unlike any other on earth,...
...a remote archipelago known as the Galapagos Islands.
Untouched by man until the late 1600s,...
...the Galapagos have a unique ecological heritage.
From Charles Darwin to modern day, scientists and adventurers...
...have long been drawn to the rugged beauty...
...and rich biodiversity of these volcanic islands.
Follow in the footsteps of the great explorers...
...with international expeditions on board the MV Evolution.
